result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michald S Pettit

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michald S Pettit in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michald S Pettit in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michald S Pettit in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michald S Pettit in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered $50 cash bail on 21CT186 and $50 cash bail on 21CT187 to be transferred to this felony case. 
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Michald S Pettit in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Michald S Pettit not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
He mailed in a letter informing the court that he is in treatment until February 23rd at Koinonia Treatment Center. Court Commissioner Dorsey agreed to vacate the court date for 2/22/2022 and adjourn the case until 3/22/2022, at 1:00 p.m. Koinonia Treatment center has been informed of the new court date and will let the defendant know about his new court date. Notice was also mailed to him home address.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Letter from defendant re:  appearing via ZOOM for upcoming hearing on 2/22/22.  (Michald S. Pettit, PO Box 1550, Rhinelander WI 54501).
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/22/22 @ 1p
